P078674.project_name: Economic Policy & Public Expenditure Management Technical Assistance Project (PEMTAG)

project_abstract.cdata: The object of the Public Expenditure Management Technical Assistance Project is to strengthen Kosovo's ability  to use public resources more effectively, efficiently, and transparently through strengthened public expenditure management.  The project has three major components. The first addresses cross-cutting problems inpublic expenditure management: budget formulation, budget execution, and procurement, focusing particularly on high-spending ministries. The remaining components support policy and procedural reforms in two key sectors. One ofthese is healthcare, with three sub-components, which will: finance implementation of the family medicine model in four municipalities; test a new system for paying providers; and provide limited training for the Ministry of Health on management, policy development and planning, and communication skills.  The other component concerns transport, which will contribute to improving both the management and use of public expenditure in the transport sector via four sub-components: expenditure allocation, financial sustainability, road safety, and traffic management by the Pristina Municipality.
